title: Python Level 2 — Conditions & Comparisons
concept: Use if, elif, else to compare numbers, classify values, and solve simple conditional tasks.

challenges.title: Maximum of Two Numbers
challenges.description: Given two integers A and B, print the larger of the two.

challenges.title: Sign of a Number
challenges.description: Given an integer N, print 1 if it is positive, -1 if it is negative, and 0 if it is zero.

challenges.title: Equal or Not
challenges.description: Given two integers A and B, print YES if they are equal, otherwise NO.

challenges.title: Even or Odd
challenges.description: Given an integer N, print EVEN if it is even, otherwise print ODD.

challenges.title: Minimum of Three Numbers
challenges.description: Given three integers A, B and C, print the smallest one.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: minimum of the three.

challenges.title: Leap Year Check
challenges.description: Given a year Y, determine if it is a leap year. Use the Gregorian rules: divisible by 400 → leap; divisible by 100 → not leap; divisible by 4 → leap; otherwise not leap. Print YES or NO.
challenges.outputDescription: YES if leap year, otherwise NO.

challenges.title: Chessboard Square Color
challenges.description: Chessboard squares are labeled (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) with 1 ≤ x, y ≤ 8. Print YES if they are the same color, otherwise NO.
challenges.inputDescription: Four integers x1 y1 x2 y2.

challenges.title: Exactly One Positive
challenges.description: Given three integers, check if exactly one of them is positive. Print YES if exactly one is > 0, otherwise NO.

challenges.title: Increasing Sequence of Three
challenges.description: Given three integers a, b, c, print YES if they form a strictly increasing sequence (a < b < c), otherwise NO.

challenges.title: Units Digit is 3?
challenges.description: Given an integer N, print YES if its last digit is 3, otherwise NO.
